Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	And now we begin the words of Albucasis.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, students, I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, in order to achieve its purpose and due to its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I have fulfilled my promise to you to complete this treatise, which is part of surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	The operation of midwifery has been completely forgotten in our region and time, until the science of it was lost, and its evidence was not preserved; and no one knows about it except some small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which were misunderstood by those who practiced it at that time before the understanding of it was closed and its strength and art were extended.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I have arranged this treatise in the second method of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and because of the forms of the tools of cautery and other instruments of the work, as well as for addition to the declaration, and for its preparation, which is necessary.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	In ancient times, the reason why a surgeon was not immediately skilled in their craft in our time is because the art of medicine is long and complex, and it requires practice in the science of anatomy, which was rediscovered by Galen before he knew the important parts of the limbs and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and also knowing the bones, nerves, and ligaments, and their number, and their hardness; and of the pulsating veins and quiet ones, and the locations of their essence.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	As Hippocrates said that one name is not enough, but in the work, it is smaller, and more so in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have not already said about him in the introduction of this book; because those who do not know what we have said about anatomy, cannot avoid falling into error, by which many men have died, as I have seen too many of them, because they are formed in this science and get their knowledge from that science and its experiments.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	When a doctor saw a woman who had been infected with a phlegmon in the neck and had punctured some neck arteries, causing great blood loss that led to her death between her hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And another doctor saw that the stone was very large and had passed through the urethra of that man, who died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And he had already tried to remove it and saw that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient, he knew that he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And another doctor saw that a duke of our land had been injured by surgery, and he went to a skilled blacksmith who was skilled in the area of the fracture; and because of his ignorance, the doctor removed the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and strong structures, and did not let the wound breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then he removed the bandage according to his desires, and removed the splint, and let it rest for several days and commanded that they remove the bandage; and during this time the wound and the foot became infected, and it reached a point of no return.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to loosen the bandage, and then he felt relief from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, the corruption was already confirmed in the limb, so it could not be restrained from that one, and it did not cease to spread the corruption in the limb until the patient died.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who pierced an abscess with cancer, and it became ulcerated around the days, until the fire magnified the malice of it against him.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The reason is that the cranium is pure of melancholic humor, so it does not allow that it reach him from all sides, but rather that it be in the limb that suffers from all of it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for that reason, children, it is necessary for you to operate in two different ways: one in the operation that is associated with health, and the other in the work that is at risk in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed in all places of this book in which the operation is performed in which there is error and fear; therefore it is necessary for you to guard that and lay aside that, so that the fools do not approach to speak to you and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And so take up your arms with solicitude and protection from God, and your patients with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Use the best way by God's grace to lead to salvation and praiseworthy succession, and relieve terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and keep your arms from that which causes you fear, so that your position in your faith and in your name will not be lost: because more remains for your glory, and further back in the world and beyond to your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Sometimes it is said in certain passages:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat a bad patient, because bad doctors will not be remembered.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already obeyed this book according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The beginning of the division of the book, and first of the first section.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered by the foot entering, in the forms of instruments and in the handles of cauteries, and of that which is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and piercing, and on vents, and on plasters, and on the extraction of bones and similar things to those, all chapters and ordered according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of torticollis and similar things to those; chapter ordered from the head to the foot, and on the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of pointed cautery and sharp medicine and memory of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	In that begins the treatise on all the free.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	That you know the quality of those remedies and of the ointments of it, and in what condition it is prohibited to use cautery.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the speech of the quality of the remedy and of the ointment of it is long and extended, and subtle for knowledge, and secretly hidden; and from there to speak much about wisdoms, and they are disagreed, and to me it suffices a little of their speeches, I fear prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And so it is said that the cautery is brought to the entire complex universally, which is called matter or its matter, except for two complexes, which are called tail complexes of matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the tail complex, dry matter is disordered; for one said that the cautery was beneficial to that, and the others said the opposite of that, which is not convenient in an illness that is due to quality and dryness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inconvenient for an illness to be cured by something that is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who said the opposite of that, they said that by cautery is made beneficial in all illness tail complexes that are found in men's bodies, because when you compare the bodies of men and their humidity to the complex of fire, the bodies of men are cold.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say by the word of that, that I have experimented with this sometime ago.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	But may not come over that which has already been extracted and exercised in the chapter of cautery by previous exercise, and has known the difference of the complexes of men and the disposition of their illnesses in their bodies, and the causes of those, and their accidents, and the space of those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other body parts, do not fear you, and especially in wet and humid diseases, since all doctors have agreed on those, and they do not disagree about the use of the pointed cautery in those.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, children, that the secret of healing by burning with fire and its goodness is that the fire is simple, the action of which only reaches the member that is cauterized and not the other member attached to it, except for a small harm.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the burning medicine does not reach those in the members that are attached to each other, and often it causes the disease to come into the sick member and often it is difficult.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	The fire, because of its greatness and the goodness of its substance, does not do this but rather it is superfluous. And we know this from experience and from the long time of service in the study of the art over the truth of the causes; and for this reason you should be excused from the length of the speech. And if it were not that it is not read aloud in this pause, to you secretly about the fire, and the quality of the operation of which in the bodies and its expulsion by which it expels diseases, which would be philosophical demonstrative, which would be sharpened in your misfortunes.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And you should know, sons, that they separate from the time in which it is appropriate to perform cauterization and wait for the best time of primevera.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	I say that cauterization is appropriate at all times, so that the harm caused by the time accident is submerged in the juice of that which is suitable for cauterization, and especially if it is for pain or necessary pain, quickly and forcefully, the ones who do not suffer delay because they fear the evil that may come from those who enter, which is greater than small harm.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And do not cautery in your feet, sons, or, I say, that which is only estimated by the common people and foolish doctors, because at that malady which is healed by cauterization is not ridiculed all the time, and they wait for that consequence.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not as there is that they fear for it, because cauterization is not only in a place of medicine which alters the appearance and dries out the moistures which are the cause of pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But nevertheless, cauterization is performed excessively on the medicine for the sake of its value and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the patient's illness will return in some hour of time, depending on the complexity of the patient and the location of their illness, and their condition, and what is prepared in their body from the accumulation of excess in them, and what they have acquired through their acquisition of foods and similar causes; but if the illness in which they are administered cauteri is a subtle illness in a member of few excess and moisture, as with a tooth cautery for pain and similar causes, it is possible that in them that pain will not return, but rather something else is done in small amounts.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	Furthermore, the common belief is that cauteri is the last resort of medicine, and the noble belief is not what I understand in them, because they believe that there is no cure that is more effective than medicine or another cause for appropriate cauteri.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is contrary to that; and the understanding that cauteri is the last resort of medicine is not only when they administer the methods of cure in some illnesses, and those medicines do not help, and at the end of the cause they administer honey cauteri, and it helps at that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And usually, after this point, the cautery of the last remedy of medicine is not understood by the common people and many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that gold cautery is better than iron cautery, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the superiority of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for cauterization does not cause harm, because it is not absolutely true, as you have already seen and heard of those who use gold in their bodies instead of others, and gold cautery is good and better than iron cautery, but however when you make cauterization with fire of gold, it is not your decision, because it is made according to the quantity that you want for the roughness of the gold, and because it prepares to receive the humor; and if you adjust over the fire, the gold melts in the fire, and some sheets are prepared by the craftsman for that purpose.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this reason, iron cautery is made lighter and more directly to the direction of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter in the second chapter of the cautery, and I have ordered those between the feet, so that they ask him what he wants from there.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for head pain caused by coldness and moisture.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery is caused by moisture and coldness over the body, which are the causes of many traumatic accidents, called coronary artery disease, from the head to the parts of the shoulders and ears, and many sleep disturbances, and pain in the teeth and jaw, and universally from all illnesses that occur due to coldness, such as paralysis, stroke, and similarities in those diseases.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first, you command the patient to take laxative medicine to cleanse his head for three or four nights, according to the patient's age and habit.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and then do that shaving between your hands on a tilted chair, and place your hand over his chest.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And place your thumb on top of the patient's nose between their eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, when the location you mentioned is reached, mark that spot and then remove the pointed cautery or the olive-shaped one.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that one over the location that is best suited for the attempt, holding it with your hand as it descends, and gradually tighten it until it is firmly held. Then rotate that one.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then slightly raise your hand and look at the location, and if you see that some amount of bone has been exposed, such as the amount of grain, then raise your hand. If your hand does not return to its original position, then place it on that iron or another one, if it is cold, before it is visible from the bone that I have told you about.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a small amount of salt and dissolve it on that location and leave it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place a clean cloth over that location and leave it there until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then care for the wound with the four-herb ointment until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And they said that when the plague is opened, as much harm gets out of the arm, so it becomes better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that a cautery should be applied to the sinew inside the bone, and it should be held with the cautery until some part of the bone is attached.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then wipe away that which is attached to the bone, and then care for it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others said that the cautery should reach the back, until it enters strongly into the bone before it breaks, and this is the way to make a small incision:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate that from that wound the evil spirits escape from the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and then cared for until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two kinds of cautery in all men, except for those who are second in fear; and let that one be better for your health when it is, because the head is revealed by the solution of continuity of which we have testified in the other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of a natural nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first type of cautery is safer and better for me, and from that house and that work saves life.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cauteries of the chapter.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When in the entire chapter there are chronic and long-lasting pains, and that is prolonged in the patient, and uses garlic, charcoal, capipurges, ointments, guaiacum, cadels, gualinas, and similar things, and more so if it has already been cauterized with a certain cautery that they know and do not improve from any of those causes, then consider that if the chapter of the patient is of great creation in its nature; and not free and easily moved by a great fright, then that cauterizer should use another cauterization after that one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize it on the top of its chapter with the cauterization before the codex is broken.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the codex and expose the bone in the amount that we have found and cauterize it with a cautery in the part behind the chapter in the place called the bladder, — and that is the place where the pillow is placed.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And let your hand remain in that position, and do not expose the bone, as the patient may experience great pain different from all other cautery pains of the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	I would say that this cautery is in that location, because it is the one that burns the corns of the head and the occipital region is a more subtle cautery than the one that burns the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Third chapter.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	Of the ancient non-antique cautery of the emerging.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is pain in the part of the head that is sharp and sudden, or when the pain extends to the stomach, let the medicines that relieve the head be evacuated, and let the other cure be administered, which I have mentioned in the books on illnesses; and all is not appropriate, then the cautery in this case is done in two ways: either with a sharp burning medicine or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	The sharp burning medicine is that you take a thin piece of iron, and scrape it on that and apply the ends of it to the affected parts with some powder.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then approach the location of the pain with a small scalpel inserted into the skin where the pain is located, and hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then apply pressure to the area stopped by constriction, and leave it for three hours; then remove the bandage and treat the wound for two or three days, and then place a poultice over the affected area where the pain is located.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for it until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do so with some remedies that I have written about in the other treatise on remedies.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	The cauterization is done in this way: light the cautery of which this is the shape:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a claw hammer because its head is shaped like a carnation with some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small projection.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place your hand over the location of the pain, and remove your hand - so that the scab that is left does not stick to the wound - and rotate the small iron at speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	If the amount of blood that is held back due to the tightness of the ligature is too much for the patient, and you lift your hand to prevent the artery from being held back, which is left, so that no bleeding occurs.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a bandage soaked in salt water over the area, and leave it there for three days; then apply a wet bandage, and then care for the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, cauterize the tip of the knife according to the cautery, and be careful not to cut the artery in this area.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient wounds.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you care for a wound that we have mentioned in the previous cure, and the cure that we have mentioned in the divisions of illnesses, and if you do not apply the cure, and if the wound does not allow the first cautery or the cautery of fire, then wait until the cautery is whitish, as it means above the location of the pain, along the long line that is the main one, or another; then place your hand for a short while and strongly in the area where you pierce the artery and reach the bone.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to guard against the continuity of the mandible, which is often damaged by chewing, and that the jaw not be stuck and the nerve that may be affected, and that it does not become spasm.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it is about the custody and care of the flow of blood from the artery that is being cautery, where in the cauterization of which there is fear, and more especially for those who do not know what to do and are not studious; and leave the operation in its beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you will find the remembrance of the regimen for the flow of blood from the artery according to its own method, in its own place in this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see this disease that does not allow this cauterization and you see the patient's body tolerably well, cauterize that in the middle of the head as we have reported, and cure the wound before it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you wish, administer the cauterization that we have mentioned in the chapter of stretching of the artery as cauterization having two points, and this is the best cauterization and more conformable.
Capitol .v.	Chapter V
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	Of the cauterization of the pains of gout.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When pain occurs in the big toe due to infiltration and is cured by causing laxatives and the other cure as mentioned in the previous section, and the pain does not remain, then use the cauterizer, and this one has no point, of which this is the form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	And then bring the point close to the fire, and it should be moved around the entire big toe as if it were turned over, or in the circuit of each one if the pain is in each one.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	With the cauterizer, slowly touch the tip of the big toe as much as possible without hurting the place with the attempt.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if the cauterizer touches all the big toe, and it is felt, then cure the places before they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI
De cauterizacio de turtura.	Of the cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Torture that is cured and is not cured by cauterization except for the species that come through flexion, as we have said in the sections of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the affected area due to dryness or spasm of the nerves.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that area of turmoil with Jew's remedies and capiciol, and do not combine your treatment, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: the first from the golden hair, the second a little further from the temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your hand on the opposite side of the affected area, as softening only occurs in the visible part.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is that you cauterize that part with the cauterizing instrument at the right of the golden hair, a little further up from the crown of the head, and in the temple another, the longest of which should be second to the length of the first, and place your hand over the cauterizing instrument until the quantity of the majority of the affected area is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	And this is the form of the cauterizing instrument, and it is a special type of knife, the shape of which is given below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	May it however be more subtle than that one has with veils; and cover it with a cloth in case of excessive greasiness, one.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then care for the place with that which is given as procedure until it is healed.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter VII.
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	Of the cauterization of ancient apoplexy.
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot. E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	And the method of the cauteries is made according to what is said above.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	And it has already been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach; and it is more distant; and then care for the place with that which processes.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Of the cauterization of forgetfulness caused by flatulence.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	When giving medicine to the patient at the beginning of treatment, give them large and tasty pills.

E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And place some leeches, which are a method of cautery.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do this second according to the following order that has already been said.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	If those remedies are successful; and if not, then make three cautery points on the back part of his head, which should be placed in the most superior part of the head between the part that is closest to the neck.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	And place the largest amount of the said remedy between each cautery, and then care for the cautery as it is done.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you feel more pain and the patient is able to bear it, then make the cautery in the middle location; and if you feel greater pain, then cauterize that one on both feet.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then care for it until it is healed; and the cautery should be applied according to the form given.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter Nine
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of the perineum and softening of the entire body.

E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma. Capitol .x.	Chapter Ten

Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of the cauterization of melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted moisture and thin, then cauterize those with the cautery we have mentioned in the one that has paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is excessive and tending towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then give him that which purifies his brain according to that which has preceded in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And then shave the head of the patient, and make a clean incision on his scalp according to the circle, and place that there in the middle of his head.

And then give that person a bath every week, following the other regimen of their body until they are healed; or if you want, make small points with a pointed cautery according to the most appropriate part, as long as you have your hand on a cautery that is properly ordered: this is a special kind of cauterizer that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place your hand on that side that is swollen in bed or in grayish wool.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII.
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Of the cauterization of water descending into the belly.
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When it is declared to you that the beginning of water in the belly by the symptoms that I have mentioned in the division, then begin and give to the patient that water which softens their head, and keep that one from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And make that one sweat in hot water for several days.

And then command the patient to tilt their head, and cauterize that spot with the pointed cautery in the middle of the forehead; and then cauterize that spot with two cautery instruments on two temples if it is the beginning of a headache in two hemispheres, or with one if it is the beginning of a headache in one hemisphere.

E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	And you should know the skill of extracting ligaments and puncturing those and preventing blood flow.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes cautery is applied to the neck behind two bones with two cautery instruments produced earlier.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.

Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses. Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIV.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	About cauterization of bad smell from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar. E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that one.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	This is the shape of that pointed cautery.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of cauterizing the eyelids to soften them.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, then cauterize that eyelid with a pointed cautery; and this is its shape:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you do, cauterize it between the two upper eyelids a little, in the middle part, and lengthen the eyebrows.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the length of the eyelid.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too hard against the cautery, but according to the amount that the burned part of the eyelid can bear.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	When the eyelid cautery is applied to the eyelid when the eyebrows are converted into parts and puncture the eyelid.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the eyebrows are converted into parts and puncture the eyelid, the cautery is applied in two ways, either by burning or by medical means.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is by fire, command the patient to lie down with his eyes closed, while his eyelashes are prolonged and equalized; and if he punctures that which is his own nature, then strengthen the eyelids of the patient with a bandage so that they are not injured until the eyelashes have grown.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Then when they have grown and equalized, place the head of the patient on his chest, and apply a bandage over the eyelids of the patient, which should be shaped like a fan of mercy, and its beginning should be near the eyelashes.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then apply a soft cotton pad on the eyelid.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then extinguish the cautery that has this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize the figure that has been described, bit by bit, in zigzag motions, until the surface of the codex is completely burned, appearing like a map of the world.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And the sign of health from the work of healing is that you have already closed the eyelid of the eye, which has been contracted by the hairs of the eyebrows being raised for the puncture of the eye.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And then raise your hand and leave it there for three days, and place your hand over the area until the wound is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that spot until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns by the hairs for some reason, and the eyelid becomes soft, then do another cautery over that area as you had done previously.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the hairs are in the eyelid, then cauterize that area until it is raised to its natural position and is equal to the other eye, so that the hairs do not poke the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	May the pointed cautery be used as medicine to command the patient to shave their hairs that are prolonged and uneven, and then make a shape of paper or cloth like a mirror.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take some known and fresh herbs and mix them well with those causes, and make that into a poultice so that it is not scattered; and spread that over the paper which is made like a mirror, and place that over the affected area; and place the affected area on a soft cloth in a bowl of hot water, and the head of the patient should be in a comfortable position.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the patient over the medicine and press that on the affected area without causing any discomfort until the patient feels the bite of the medicine, which is like a burn from fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And when the patient feels the sharp bite of the medicine, then remove the medicine and place it on the patient's forehead; when the bite ceases, remove the medicine and wash the affected area with water; and then consider whether the eyelid has been lifted as it was when it was laved from the contraction of fire or incision, because that is good; and if not, return to the medicine on the area where the medicine has not pressed and does not disintegrate until your operation is equalized and is opposite the affected area.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place your hand over the patient's shoulder until the tumor of the disease is removed, and then cure that wound with ointment or another medicine until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And if it is necessary for you to keep your operation, you must guard it with diligent watchfulness that in the wound no more of the medicine is lost, and if the eyelid softens and some cause of the hairs punishing in the wound, then repeat your medicine on that place where the eyelid is softened, and usually do as you did at the beginning, and continue until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the method of extraction of mirtha.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you should know that the wounds of men are varied according to their size and location, and therefore your contraction is made accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not cover the path of righteousness to that one whom you study in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of the cauterization of a fistula that is in the lacrimal duct of the wound.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with the method we have mentioned in the divisions of diseases and do not compare your treatment, then command the patient to place his head on your knee, and hold his head between your hands in such a way that it is not too close nor too far.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a poultice of bread or mustard on the wound of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then take the cautery of this form:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be round, like the shape of a stick or a pen of the volt, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, it should penetrate into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want it to be sharp, like a needle.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But the round one is better for the work of the body.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and introduce some saliva and dry it out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	If it has not been opened, then open that and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place your hand over the heated cautery, and hold it with a small cloth from the elbow to the part of the nose, so that your hand or the patient is not burned, and then place the cautery on the elbow and burn that.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	If at the beginning of the treatment the cautery goes into the bone, it is well; and if not, then repeat the cautery once or twice, depending on the case; and leave that for three days, and then place your hand over that to apply a dry ointment until it is healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after several days it has not healed, then place the sharp acidic medicine inside the bone until it is revealed and scraped as appropriate in its capital part.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And there is another method of cauterizing the fistula that was first described: enter at the location of the fistula and open that, and then place your hand in that fissure which is the shape of the bone: And from there put a quantity of one unc of lead; and hold your hand well with retention, and do not burn the patient because the lead does not reach the elbow of that; and cover that over the elbow of the patient with album of egg white or water, where the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals that for wonderful healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed by what we have said about the cauterization and the cure, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to administer a nose drop and reduce the fistula to the nose when it comes to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18:
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery for the cleft palate.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	These are accidental fissures that occur in the lips, and more frequently in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you cure those fissures with what we have said about the divisions and do not expand your cure, then use the small cauterizing iron in this form that is made as follows:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And place it according to the thickness of the spoon.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place your finger carefully in those fissures until the cauterizing iron reaches the edge of the fissures.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure it with wax until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19:
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of cautery for a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the uvula or on the palate or on the teeth, an abscess occurs and a blister is made, and it is torn, and it is peeled off, and it is punctured, and a fistula is formed, and then you care for that and do not leave the treatment, since you should ignite the cautery according to the amount that has been received in the fistula, and put that ignited cautery into the mouth of the fistula, and your hand enters until the hot iron reaches the front of it, and at the back of it make a small incision or two; and then care for that which we have said about the treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the sinus is removed and healed, then it is good; but if not, then it is necessary to discover the location and treat the rotten bone according to what comes in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of cautery for the teeth and of softening of the jaws.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the joints are softened by moisture and the teeth are rotted, and those remedies do not cure them, then pause the patient's head on your thigh, and approach the heated iron in the form that will come to you, so that you place the quill on the tooth and insert it into that place where the iron is hottest, and hold it there for a short time until the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then lift your hand, and repeat the cautery several times as you wish.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the patient should close their mouth with salt water and hold it for an hour, as that rotten tooth is sealed, the softened gums are strengthened, and the corrupted moisture is dried out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the cautery for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness, or if it is frozen or worms, and the remedy does not cure it, then use the cautery in that place in two ways: either with a cow's horn cautery, or with a fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	When you take the pointed cautery, grab a piece of iron from the fire, and then wrap it with cloth, and place it over the end of the tent, and then immerse that pointed cautery, and place it over the painful tooth quickly before it is cooled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeat those movements until the power of the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see, immerse some wool or cloth in the pointed cautery above, and place that over the painful tooth, and place it over the burning iron until the iron reaches the root of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the cauterization with fire is that you wait until the sound of iron or iron, and if there is any groaning in his body and the heat of the fire does not reach the mouth of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then ignite the cautery in the form that comes, and place that over the tooth and your hand inside when the cautery is cooled; and do that some movements until the pain remains or on that day or on the other day.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And if the patient bites down on the good border of that cautery, hold it for an hour and then scrape it off; this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And burn whatever you can reach with your hand.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	Of burning outgrowths.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When outgrowths are soft and caused by humors that are not obedient to digestion by medicines, and you want to gently remove them, then ignite the cautery with the shape of which is as follows, having two ends easily so that the smoke from the cautery can pass through the other end, and place that ignited end over the abscess, and another if necessary, until it reaches the center of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and leave it for three days and place it on the side in boiling water until it has burned out that which the fire has burned.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that wound and treat it with bandages until it heals.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	The shape of the needle or pointed cautery is such that it should be used in this way.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of the cauterization of a bunion and of its contraction.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity comes over the thoracic cavity, especially when it is caused by coldness, then it is recommended that the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that part of the gallbladder in the area where the pain is located.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to reach the cautery to the gallbladder or burn the intestinal canal of it, but a little bit.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that part with another cautery at the joint of the neck in the lower spine of it.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cautery of it should be like the previous one.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that wound until it heals.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of the cautery for lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When a cough and lung disease are caused by moist humors that the patient does not have fever or chills, and it is an old disease, then cauterize with two cauteries on the collarbone in the locations where the ribs meet and curve; and with another cauteri in the middle of the chest between two nipples; and let the cauteri be shaped according to the previous form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, your cauterization should be made with the pointed cautery called puncta, whose form precedes in the punctation of heel pain.
