If it is late when its appearance begins, then consider if it is hard, dark in color and has little sensation, do not touch that with iron which is a crusty abscess; because those swollen veins that inscribe this abscess end up causing great harm to that which the person had.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the abscess is of lion-like touch and not of dark color, and when its appearance is possible in all of it, then evacuate the patient and inscribe that sense of fear, and cure the location with what dries and constricts before it is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	Of sutures of the nose and of the lips and of the ear when continuity is dissolved by pressure or similar causes.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when dissolution of continuity occurs in one of these cartilages, do not perform surgery on this operation unless in certain men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when you notice any cause of those, whether it is fresh bruising or not, and then adjust the two lips of the wound with stitches, and care for that until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the lips of dissolution of continuity are already separated, and each is made healthy, then notice that you scrape each part of their exposed skin until it is healed.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then adjust the two lips with stitches and strengthen those, and above them sprinkle healed skin of dragon and three-leaved watercress, and place a layer of diachylon plaster or of any other consolidating plaster on top of the powder, and leave that for two days or three, and then remove that and replace that plaster and care for that until the wounds are healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	May the solution of continuity or needles be added as we recommended in the abdominal suture, or add the solution of continuity with the thread that you have used and make it known.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	About the extraction of those causes that come in the lower abdominal regions.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Some women in the lower abdominal regions of their abdomen have hard abscesses similar to pus-filled boils, and some are smaller and some are larger.
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, you should cut the abscess and each of those hard parts, and fill the location with a triple antiseptic until it is strong enough, and then wash with vinegar and treat the location with that which has stiptic properties until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	About the insertion of flesh in the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	A great number of people have flesh inserted in the gums, which the ancients called albus, therefore you should suspend that with an onion or that which you have with the forceps and insert it into its place, and leave the wound to run or the scar.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And place your hand on the affected area, or cover it with strengthening or stimulating powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if the flesh returns, then scrape it secondarily, and cauterize it, so that the cautery does not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De razo de dentz am ferr.	Of the reason for iron teeth.
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When sharp, rough, and sometimes black scratches are adjusted on the surface of the teeth, in the parts of the jaw and between the gums, and they become yellow or green before corruption appears, then the teeth are black.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And therefore you should clean the patient between your hands and place your head on their chest, and remove the teeth in which those scratches and similar sand appear before any cause, and this is how blackness and yellowness and other colors are caused when they are not cleaned.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	If this is the case at the beginning of the reasoning, then it is good; otherwise, you should repeat the reasoning on those teeth on the next day and the second and the third until the last statement in what you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth require various shapes of files and different figures according to what is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And so that you know which file is used to shape the part of the tooth that is not between the teeth and another file that is used to shape between the teeth in different ways, and these forms of files should be prepared by you as follows:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	Of tooth extraction.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	You should cure the tooth from all pain and delay in its entire extraction, because there is no reason that exceeds the speed of its extraction when it is extracted, because its substance sublimates within which the extraction takes place.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	May it be so that when the patient is prepared to have that tooth extracted, you must certainly be certain which tooth is causing pain, because sometimes the pain deceives the patient and thinks it is in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and the pain does not cease until the bad tooth and the painful one are extracted, as we have already seen this through the operation of the teeth.
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, when you need to determine which tooth is causing the pain, and you know how to do it, then carefully cut around the tooth with some tool that has some benefit, until the tooth is completely separated from the gum in all parts, and then pull that out, or use fine forceps to slowly separate it little by little until that concavity is formed.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then place a large log in front of the patient's head for good conversation or to prevent him from spitting out what he has, and carefully place the tooth in a straight manner so that it does not touch the patient or cause him more pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And therefore, if it is not forgotten, then take one of those tools and place it next to the tooth in all parts to facilitate and reduce the effort of removing it at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or worn, then carefully wrap that part and tightly hold it with a thin thread at the end so that it is not broken during your construction on that tooth.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And you should work carefully on incising around the entire part of the gum and guard your strength so that you do not tear it away from there, and return over the patient for the greater pain that is first felt by them.
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And guard yourself that you do not do what ignorant barbers do in their practices and audacity in the eradication of them, since they do not administer what we have recommended; for many methods bring great ills upon people, which are more difficult than those that can be counted, and all of their reasons remain, or some of those, or that extract from there with ignorant barbers have testified.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And the eradication of it should be washed the mouth with vinegar or with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if there is an excess of blood flowing from the wound, as many methods have it, then cut off some amount of zeal and sprinkle it on the wound, and if you do not confirm that zeal, cauterize.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The form of the forceps and holding them subtly is what is praised for its use at the beginning of long extractions, with a short handle and large, so that they are not bent when performing those tasks.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And there should be times with large handles until when you have those, they are not bent, and short extractions.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they should be made of Indian iron, straight extraction forceps, and in the extractions of those, they have teeth of which one is inserted into the other and are pulled with great strength, and sometimes shaped like the beak of a goose, which is called ciconia, it is held, and they are of great strength.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter XXXI.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the removal of teeth and extraction of bones from the jawbones that are impacted.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you have to remove a tooth that is impacted in some way, then place your hand over the location adjacent to the border for one day or two until that place is softened; and then introduce anesthetics or hold the extraction forceps of which are shaped like the beak of a goose called ciconia or held, the shape of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	The outer parts of their hands were cut off with a knife or scissors.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if they do not obey you with these forceps or hold them, then it is customary to put a clamp on the wound and remove all the flesh and insert the instrument called the atali, which is a small hook with a shape like this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And if it is short and thick, then make it small, and do not make it too long or thin.
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Then if the wound is not too wide, it is good; otherwise, help yourself with these other instruments of which the following are the shapes: the shape of the first instrument is a triangular extramit that has some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The shape of the second instrument is that it be triangular and have a more slender extension.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now you have helped yourself with this instrument having two prongs, the following is the appropriate shape:
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	And you will need other instruments that I will describe in the removal of teeth; for this is done with an instrument that resembles a hook, and this is the shape:
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	from the triangular distal end that is too short or curved, which is some swelling, and not thin enough to be a triangle.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And another wise thing is that the instruments of teeth are similar to other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	May the craftsmen be skilled and subtle in the art, so that they can do the operation and treat various diseases; for some of these diseases are of such different shapes that the ancients did not say or describe a proper instrument for them.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	 May it be triangular the bone of the jaw or of other bones of the mouth, or if it is decayed, then carefully remove it from its place with the instruments and forceps that we have mentioned in the extraction of the roots of the teeth, and help you to do this:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	 And if there is some swelling little by little, then pull it or hold it in the mouth so that it does not escape or go inside until the bone of the entire jaw is removed; and then restore the place with appropriate medicines for that.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is a small pustule on the bone, then puncture that pustule and its black core, and cure it within so that it becomes healthy.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	About the care of prominent teeth compared to others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When teeth are prominent and do not follow their natural course, especially when they grow towards women, and more so towards revered virgins; therefore, you should consider: if a tooth is not in line with another tooth, and no fistula or linen can be placed near it, then extract that tooth. However, if it is not attached to another tooth, then you should insert it into this instrument, which has the following form; it resembles a pig's trough, and should be made of Indian iron with an extra sharp edge.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And if you have inserted it into the instrument for too many days due to the hardness of the tooth, and it is not adjacent to another tooth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if a prominent tooth is exposed to the gum, then file it with an Indian iron file of the following form.
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And use only one iron from India and the mallet; and use pointed tools like limes, which are made of agates, which are sharpened little by little in days of difficulty, so that no other tool is worn out and broken.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then draw lines on that side, and shave it with a safety razor.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if there is a part that is bathed and the tongue lies, then you should clean it inside so that the asperity of that fraction is covered and equalized, and is filled to prevent the tongue from falling out or the word being corrupted.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of worn-out teeth with gold or silver.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When accidents occur to the teeth before concussion and removal by impact or fall, and the patient cannot bear that which hurts, and you have cured it with a hemostatic medicine, and your cure has not been successful, then for so that they do not rot in those that are strong and made of gold and not of silver, because silver turns and becomes poor soon, but gold never changes.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And if the patient is too thin and rough, according to the amount that could enter between the teeth; and the method of the recitation is that you take the patient and double him between two healthy teeth, and approach that he increases in two tortuous ways of the patient between two ugly ones, or if one or more, until the thread reaches the healthy tooth of the other part.
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then repeat the tessiment into the part where you started, and strengthen your hand with ease and knowledge until it is not ugly.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your string be the one that strengthens the patient from the reasons of the teeth that do not escape.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then cut off the superfluous parts of the patient from the forceps or scissors, and add those in each place with gestures, and convert those and hide them between the healthy tooth and the ugly one, so that it does not cause harm to the tongue.
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then let that strict one with Roman.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is broken or rough, strengthen those or those on the other patient in such a manner in all its time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of healthy teeth and the figure of straight teeth, as follows:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when a tooth or teeth return to their respective places in these areas, they are reformed as we have recommended, and remain so.
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	Only skilled artists and wise people can do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	Some wounds are suitable for some causes of cow bones, and they are made into the shape of teeth, placed in the location where the tooth is missing, strengthened as we have said, and remain and serve for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	Of the beginning of the thread that runs through the tongue and prevents speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament that runs from the tongue to some wounds or is natural and has been there since birth, or accidental and has occurred due to an injury that is already consolidated.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation in this is that the mouth of the patient is opened, and their own cap is placed on the tip; then the tongue is raised, and the thread is inserted according to the width until the tongue is released from its recension.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	If there is any difficulty or resistance in that area, and that is due to the consolidation of plague, then you should use force and cut through that part where it has not yet been incised and the tissue has not been dissolved.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And be careful not to make a deep incision in the flesh and cut through this area so that there is no bleeding of pus.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then wash the footprints of the incision with clean water, warm water, or cold water; and place your hand over the tongue to prevent the patient from swallowing anything else that is not consolidated.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	If there is any bleeding of pus, place your hand over the area where the blood is coming from; if the pus flows out, then cauterize the area with a pointed cautery that is suitable for that purpose.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the other causes so that the patient can be healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a ranula from the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	Some times the tongue is swollen and resembles a small protuberance that prevents the tongue from performing its natural operation; and if it is not treated quickly, it becomes very large and fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	The operation in this case involves opening the patient's mouth and examining the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	If you see that the abscess has a dark or black color and the patient does not feel pain, do not touch that part.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If it is whitish, indicating moisture, then you should insert a thin probe into it and incise it from all parts; if pus comes out in the course of your operation, then pause over the wound with a piece of cloth until it is restricted.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work until you have completed it, until it is washed with warm vinegar and salt; and cure the other part with that treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	Of the extraction of abscesses from the armpits and that which is none in the groin and of the other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an abscess occurs in the groin, they are glands that are similar to wool, which are deformed and are called armpits, which when you cure them with that which we have said in the division and is not healed, then consider whether the abscess is hard, of dark color, and little pain, then do not touch that with a knife.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of dark color and the root is large, then do not touch that with a knife for the sake of the wound; instead leave that to become ripe, and then either you will break that, or it will break by itself.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, thin, and the root of it is thin, then that should be lanced.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation in it is that you consider, giving your operation, whether it has recovered from the abscess with caution completely or if it has decreased somewhat; and then make sure the patient lies on their side, and the head of it is in your hand, and the server takes between his hands the tongue of it, and the servant takes the instrument most noble of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or aram, and be thin like a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	So when you press that tongue and it shows you the abscess, then grab that cloth, place it over the wound, and pull it out as much as possible.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing that you pull from the membranes, and then incise it with this instrument of which this is the shape:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is similar to forceps, but the outer parts of which are curved, so that the opening of each of those is at the end of the other, in order to be sharp and made of iron and well-sharpened.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	However, if this instrument is not at your disposal, then incise it with this spatula of which this is the shape of it: And it should be sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And since you have incised one wound, then incise the other according to this method of incision, and then place it on the patient's body, guarding against water logging.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is an internal bleeding, wash the wound with decoction of milfoil or marigold and similar to those of astringent causes that restrict the flow of blood, and cure it within that time when it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes, in the abdomen, other abscesses or those two golden ones, and incise them as I have said at the beginning of these two melons equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I have already treated a woman with an abscess that was not in her abdomen, the abscess tended to a dark color, with little pain, which had already closed her abdomen, and the woman was breathing very streightly, and had already prohibited her from eating and drinking water, and had already reached death if more days passed.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had already pushed so much that it had half a finger's width between two ribs.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore, I cut it out carefully and placed it in one of the bones, and pulled out that, and threw away a great portion of it, and then I incised that from where I understood from the other wound, and then I covered the mouth of it, and pressed her tongue, and then I placed the bone in that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then approach with a large amount of lint, but do not remove any of it at once, but a little at a time.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore, the entire gallbladder of that woman was removed, and soon afterwards, she began to bleed profusely, and then immediately applied a piece of cloth, and did not cease incising that abscess with an old knife for a long time, and successive abscesses appeared in place of that one, which incised until it was prolonged.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore, you should apply a poultice and cauterize the gallbladder of that woman, and then apply this remedy; and then you should walk around and not say what God has done for that woman near me.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the incision of the gallbladder when it is abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the catarrh causes the gallbladder to become abscessed and long, it is then called perpendicular; and if it is in the part behind which is thick and round, it is then called a bubble.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	When the aforementioned condition is healed, and you do not continue your treatment, and if you have already seen that the abscess has been removed from it and is still subtle, then you should insert a round one; and if it is at a certain length, and is bloody, of dark color or black, and is not in the center, then you should try to remove it, as there is a fear over the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	When you see the second way that I have mentioned about its whiteness and length, then you should examine the patient and take their tongue with an instrument that allows you to determine its shape and place the bone in a new one, and remove that one and insert it with one of two instruments that are called in the insertion of two needles.
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And make sure that you do not insert it except with what is adjusted according to the natural term of its addition, because if you insert it from there, you will cause him to speak.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And when you insert it, use what we have recommended in the insertion of two needles, and cure that until it is healed.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the patient was frightened by the beginning of the operation, their fear and the sharpness of the cautery in their mouth are only water, and you should place your hand on the patient's head, and then press the tongue with the instrument we have mentioned, and take some of the water we have mentioned in the chapter on cauterization, and make a living cause from it, and do not press too hard or too subtly, and fill the hollow of the instrument which has this form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	The exterior of the hollow where the medicine is placed should be like the concavity of a spoon, and place the instrument on the medicine over the mouth, and the patient should bite on their own side to prevent saliva or other secretions from the mouth from entering the instrument due to the intrinsic medicine, so that no cause remains in the instrument.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then place your hand on the medicine and press it on the uvula for the space of an hour until it is denigrated and sedated by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take a cloth and wrap it around the end of the bone, immerse the cloth in the medicine, insert the bone into a thin tube where the cloth adheres, and leave it there until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the bone, and then remove it after three days or four.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, repeat that one, and after removing the cauterization, clean the area around the bone with a border, modify the remaining medicine in the circuit of the bone, wash it with cold water, and treat it with embrocation, and give it gargle medicines until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	This special cure is safer than the beginning and longer-lasting in fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Some people have been cured of the bone with a substance that is more subtle than cauterization and the beginning, which is cured by subfumigation in this way: take calamint, hyssop, origan, rue, Arabic scicados, camomile, broyda and similar to those of the herbs, and adjust all those herbs or some of them in a bowl, and they should be immersed in very hot water and boiled; and the bowl should be well washed with decent water, and there should be a strainer over the bowl, on which a tool made of aram according to this method should be placed; it can be made of silver or aram.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	If the patient's tongue is inserted into their mouth before the steam reaches the uvula on the throat, it can be an obstruction to the uvula.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat this procedure until it is dry, and be careful not to perform this cure at the onset of an abscess, because it would worsen the abscess, and do not do this, but rather make a declaration of the abscess from there carefully.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	However, if you do not have this instrument presently, then take a cane and make a cloth of honey in the patient's mouth, because the mouth of the patient will be moistened, as the honey cloth prevents the steam from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this cure is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	Of the extraction of thorns and of what adheres to the buttocks and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Wet cloths adhere to the buttocks or a thorn of the foot or some other cause.

Then cover that which is visible from those things, on which the gaze rests, rather than using a tongue depressor instrument for sunlight, so that it is declared to you what is in the mouth.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which is not visible and is hidden in the mouth, cover it with a cloth, so that you make the patient vomit, so that the food is digested in the stomach, because often the cause of the mouth disease is removed by vomiting; or the patient takes a piece of bread or a slice of lemon or a bowl of salt water; or takes a sponge sea lion, and places it very firmly on that, so that when the sponge is placed in the place where the spikes are and are removed, often the cause is removed.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And often take an eel and place it very firmly on that, and let it sit for a while and then extract it; or take a pig's bladder and place it firmly on that, and let it sit for a while and then remove it.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	If we do not forget those causes that we have mentioned, then use an instrument of this form:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And it should be as thick as a small one, and on the outside of it, there is a cavity that you insert into the patient's mouth for ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And the head is elevated in it, and be careful that the touch of the bones of the neck does not occur to him, so that he does not suffer from this and that which the doctor puts on his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But if the patient feels pain from this, because of his knowledge of the location of the cause adjacent and puts it in downwards, and pulls his hand on the instrument upwards, all of this according to the quantity that is prepared for him before he forgets.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	Of the extraction of blood adjacent to the neck.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When the blood adjacent to the neck is treated with the medicines that we have mentioned in the division of the cure and not with comforts, consider then in the neck of the patient at noon, because you want to understand the tongue of him with the instrument that you have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	If you see the bleeding, remove it from that place with a small or precisely handled instrument.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if you cannot remove that instrument, then take a concave needle and insert it into the wound of the patient, and place an ignited iron in the hollow of the needle, and do this as many times (until the bleeding is stopped and it stops coming out of the wound) and keep the patient away from all water for the whole day.

And then take a wet cloth full of water and wipe the mouth of the patient with that, and wash the mouth with that; and do not give any food or drink to the patient for an hour, and then another servant holds their hand, as the bleeding has stopped.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	And if the recommended instrument is not forgotten, then fumigate the patient with camomile or with asafetida using the instrument that was recommended in the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, and it will be well.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And another way of performing this operation is that you take an olive branch with burning embers and cover it with a cloth in the middle of which there is a hole, and place the tip of the instrument in that hole; and then remove the subfumigation; and put the patient's mouth on the end of the tube, and close their mouth so that the subfumigation is not lost until you know that the subfumigation has reached the blood vessels, which will soon occur.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if not, then repeat the subfumigation after several days, and prevent the patient from drinking, eating salty and other foods, and not drinking water, and if necessary this regimen should be discontinued.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument used to treat blood from the vein when it is visible; and it resembles forceps with sometimes, but it has some curvature in it.
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	le qual should be at the head of the patient, and its tip resembles the beak of a heron, which is used to scrape, in which there is a rough edge made from lime, so that when it finds any cause, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the main part of the speech on the extraction and sectioning of abscesses.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are special types of tumors, of various sizes and shapes, according to the memory of them, each in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are different in puncture and sectioning, depending on their size and shape, of which one is for the special type of abscesses that can be inserted; and because of this, they understand the moisture.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second type is for the places where the body is affected, such as the head, which is different from the abscess in the anus; and the abscess in the fleshy part is different from the abscess in the joint; and each of them has a specific operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And more about abscesses, some of which are not to be punctured until their maturation is approaching or they have reached it.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	And other abscesses that are to be lanced when they are ready, not until their maturation is approaching or they have reached it, just like abscesses that are near joints, an abscess that approaches a joint, the cause of which is in its circuit, and very often the tendons or nerves of that joint are corrupted, so that contraction of that member occurs; or it is an abscess near a principal member, and if you delay the puncture until it is matured, it will not be cured by the principal member; or it is near the anus, so lance it before it is matured; and do not lance it if it is not ready for digestion, but only the one that is near the anus, so that it does not pierce the intestine and is prolonged to the parts inside the anus, and it is made a fistula, or that it is made in the term of it that is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	When you know the right time for the incision of the abscess, that is when it is ripe.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you know that it is ripe when the pain ceases and the fever subsides, and there is a decrease in chills and pulse, and an increase in the hardness of the abscess, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And you know that the incision should be made in the location where the pus is most present, and from there will come the cure of the abscess.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	The incision should be made quickly through the long bones of the body or the flesh, if the abscesses are in the joints of the legs or feet, and in the locations of the lungs, of the nerve cords, of the arches; and at the back, in all equal places where there is no reflection; because in those that have reflection, use incision according to that member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	When the abscess is in fleshy places, it is customary to make the incision before the digestion of the pus according to the complement that we have said; because if you incise that one first, the length of the wound of the patient and its disagreeable appearance, and very hard lips, and deep depth are prolonged.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	May one perforate boils according to the latitude of the flesh or bone, as necessary, or according to what the member indicates.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should administer small perforations, and in large boils, large perforation and wide or deep incisions according to the difference in size of the boils.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others of the boils in which you should advise that the core be incised and squeezed, when made so that the pus and fluid are expelled, as if it were already stigmatized, as in the case of those that occur in the groin and armpits.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that have incisions with three angles; and of those that are incised with a figure like a fan of myrtle, as in the case of boils in the armpits.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those that are administered round incisions and lunar incisions, and similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	May one who does not have such a thing as shallow boils, advise that you make a superficial perforation or just flatten it.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	When the abscess is large and has already collected much pus, do not hesitate to lance it; take out a portion of the pus, and the next day introduce a smaller piece into the wound, and gradually increase the size of the piece removed until it is completely healed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	Especially if the patient is very young, female, a child, elderly, or in a state of old age and decay, where the animal spirit is more weak and resolved at the exit of the pus, and often the patient dies, and you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Be very careful with this chapter when performing incisions on abscesses, so that you remove the pus and consider whether the pus of the abscess is little or a flat section; then administer any appropriate remedies or antidotes. If the abscess is large and the fissures of the incision are deep, carefully apply pressure to each part until they converge.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if a piece of the tendon or a part of it is removed from the abscess or hollowed out in that place, then cover it with a piece of old cloth or new cloth made of fabric, as when you have taken out splinters or thorns, which are wet; and strengthen it on the third day; and then proceed to treat it and cure it with the same thing that comes from the wound until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	And if blood flows during the operation, then you administer cold water and vinegar in which a cloth of linen has been soaked, and place that over the location where the blood is flowing from the wound.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	And if the blood flow persists, then cover it with a remedy and cure, and powder the ones that have been recommended in various places of this our book and of division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	And if it is in the winter time, and the location of the abscess is in a place of many nerves, then cover it with powders in vinegar and oil cauteric, and place those over the locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If it is in summer, and the wounds are fleshy, then you should place poultices made of ground barley or vinegar and oil or wine and oil, and all of this should be applied within the first day, as we have said, and then you should remove the abscess and clean that area and administer to it what is suitable for its healing within the first day.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of abscesses universally, but according to the method of distinction that I have already mentioned, each abscess should be treated differently by different means specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the incision of abscesses that occur in the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck of the head, small abscesses, and especially those containing membranous sacs that are their own; and the species of these are as follows.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And some of them are pointed, and of those that contain moisture similar to honey.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those that contain moisture similar to sweat, and similar to theirs; and of those that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the dry section, and in the extraction of those that do not fear, as you should extract those that do not cause resistance.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in the dry section of those that you extract with an instrument of the form that you approach it, which is called a probe, until you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	If that which contains is moisture, then cut that instrument in sections according to its length and on the surface according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin in the section of the line of B until the line of G. So when the moisture is evacuated, then you scrape that which contains that moisture, and do not leave any cause of all, because too many troops returned, if there is any cause from it.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse it in Egyptian mud, if present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill that place and leave it there for another day, because that water corrodes all that is left of that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then repeatedly clean that wound with Egyptian gauze secondly and thoroughly if necessary, until you are confident that there is no cause for that membrane; then heal the wound when it is fully cured.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess contains thick pus, then you insert this second tool in this way:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a crochet-shaped tool, and pierce between two lips of the sewing and pull out that of all parts, and exert your skill in extracting the membrane that contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your needle causes discomfort, then do what I told you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, treat the abscess with sewing and healing according to what we have told you; sewing over an inflamed abscess is lighter, because it is less painful and less wet.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	Some people have certain remedies for these abscesses that they keep in their heads; those who are completely dry; the reason is that if you pierce an abscess on the head of an old woman and then press the abscess, it will be like a deaf stone, rough, white, which cannot be washed, and if anyone touches that, they will be harmed.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	In other parts of the body, abscesses that occur in the head are not covered in this chapter, like the abscesses that occur on the heads of children and their causes must be explained, but the section of all these should be a superficial section.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And place your hand over the lowest part of them to prevent the smell of sanctity from reaching the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And apply the appropriate remedy to that of healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the section of scrofulous glands that occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These abscesses occur in the neck and in the arms and in the elbows; and some occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, and the ones that are generated between them, and all scrofula of these is within their own tunic, and like in the nodes and abscess of the head, like we have recommended.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the specific types of these scrofula are lumps, some of which are hard, some of which contain moisture, and some of which are malignant and do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that one which you see to be of good disposition in the Tapping, whose color is propitious to the color of the codex, and is dry to all parts, and is not attached to the nerves of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the ribs, and is not adherent, so that you incise it from the dry surface of the part above the part below the line of .G. within the line of .B., and scrape it from all parts, and extend two fingers of the codex to open it, or two fingers if you have need of those, as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more important not to incise the vein or nerve.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the sponge not be sharp, so that it does not adjust to your hand when you incise, or disturb the patient, and that you do not incise what is not necessary to incise; for if you were to incise a vein or rib and prohibit from your operation, then pause in the place of triturated glass or other powders which remain fluid of sand, and clean the place, and let that enter which has paused the acuteness of the abscess and the sponge becomes soft and begins to rot.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the tooth is removed.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation before the task is completed.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And if there is any cause of the other small pustules, then examine those and cleanse them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the neck of the large vein, then do not examine that pustule from its neck.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Before you bend it too hard and let it fall out of its place, causing damage.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then complete the wound with a piece of old cloth that you have already immersed in Egyptian mud, and then cure it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you examine that pustule entirely, then make sure to adjust the two lips of the wound and cause it to heal as soon as possible, so that there is no remaining excess.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is remaining excess due to the size of the pustule, then make sure to examine its neck, and drain it, and administer sutures and that which is called.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And in the case of scrofula that contains humidity, perform a superficial puncture on this spot where it appears to you as the maturation point of it, and pause the puncture of that which is the lowest part of the neck, as we have said.

Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the separation of the head of the abscess inside the thigh.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients called this section in the abscess, and I have not seen anyone in our land who made that incision.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of their speech.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In men who have deformities, the curve should be avoided in extracting the abscess head, as it is not done well for that reason because all the veins and major parts of the patient are there.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	In those who have abscesses in the mouth or throat or two tonsils, when the illness is not in the tooth, cut off the section of epiglottis to prevent the loss that is caused by suffocation.

Therefore, when you want that, cut off three or four small sections of the epiglottis, in the area between two circles for quantity, which is in cipherac, not in cartilage, and this location is appropriate for section, which is free of flesh and the vessels of sanguine from it are less.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.
