And then place a poultice on the member, so that the poultice draws out the remaining nutrient or continued inflammation of the sick water, until the nutrient comes out and returns to its natural shape.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio dels osses trincatz quan so restauratz tortuozament e prohibeys la operacio de lor de aquo que cove.	About the treatment of broken bones when they are healing improperly and preventing their surgery due to this.
Quan accideys al membre ja restaurat aprop la sanacio de lu de tortuositat e eminencia al os trincat e nodacio, e es per aquo fededa de forma del membre, mays empero le membre no es prohibit de la sieua operacio natural, lahora no cove que tu recipias la paraula de aquel que exsistima aquel membre sia de novel trincat.	When an injury occurs to the already healed member and the bone is bent and knotted, and it is formed in the shape of the member, but however the member is not prohibited from its natural surgery, at that time do not receive the word of that person who exists that that member is newly broken.
Mays ja so statz motz fols metges e restauradors les quals han fayt aquo en nostra tera; e aquesta operacio es mot vituperable perduzent a gran temor le senhal de la qual es mortal.	However, many foolish doctors and healers have done this in our land; and this operation is so vile that it causes great fear of the death which is fatal.
Mays si claudicacio e nodacio son recentz, lahoras cove que sian enbrocatz am aygua tebeza en la qual so coytas erbas mollificantz, ayssi cum son fuelas de altea e razitz de lu, e mellilot, e semblantz ad aquels; e sia fayt a lu emplastre am emplastre mollificatio ayssi cum dyallaquilon ben fayt; o que sia preza mucillage de razit de altea e sia contucida am gray de gualina o am oli de cirami, e sia emplastrat am aquel; o que sian prezes figuas grassas e sian trissadas am fems de colom, e semblantz ad aquels de las medicinas que son nompnadas amermans consolidacio.	If the swelling and stiffness are recent, then apply a poultice made of hot water with softening herbs such as elderflowers and mint, and similar to those; and make it into a plaster with honey that is well-made; or use a decoction of mint and lettuce, and spread it on the affected area; or use figs that are crushed and mixed with fat from pork, and similar to those used in medicines called amber consolidation.
E alcunas vetz es dissolvuda am assidua fricacio leugiera que sia am las mas humidas, e sia administrat movement del membre a tota partida en totas horas.	Some of these substances are dissolved in frequent rubbing with a light oil that is very moist, and applied to move the limb throughout all its parts in every hour.
Mays si tortuositat ja es anada denant e es fayta fort e convertida es en peyra e provocada es necessitat a curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que sia le pus desus cecsat e la continuacio del os sia dissolvut, e sia inscidit aquo que superflueys de nodacio de aquel meteys am le os am inscissoris subtils, e sia aministrada facilitat en aquel am sollicitut e studi.	If the twisting has already become chronic and is strong and hardened into bone and causes the need for treatment with iron, then apply a pus from under the scar and dissolve the continuity of the bone, and cut away any excess from the swelling of that area to the bone with small surgical saws, and administer relief in that area due to its sensitivity and study.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De sermo en dislocacio.	Of speech in dislocation.
Dislocacio es eyssiment de alcuna de las juncturas del sieu loc, per que es prohibida de movement, e es orrezada la figura del membre, e fa venir sobre le malaute dolors e lesios grans.	Dislocation is an essential part of some of the joints of the body, which prevents movement, distorts the figure of the limb, and causes severe pain and injuries on the patient.
Donc quan accideys ad alcu dislocacio, lahoras cove tantost perforsar que sia reduzit, e no tarde aquela reduzir, quar si es tardada, le loc es apostemat e fort leu am aquo es fayta dificil la reduccio de dislocaccio.	Therefore, when an injury occurs in any dislocation, it is important to reduce it as soon as possible, and not delay the reduction, because if it is delayed, the limb becomes inflamed and very painful, and at that time, it is difficult to reduce the dislocation.
E per aysso no cove que sia maugut ni stendut en la hora de la apostemacio, quar motas veguadas fa venir spasme e dolors ledentz.	And in order not to be swollen or stretched at the time of inflammation, because it causes spasms and dull pain.
Mays quan aquo accideys, lahoras cove que tu te coytes a la flaubotomia del malaute, e aprop sia layssat entro que repause le apostema; e aprop le membre sia embrocat am aygua cauda e oli, e aprop sia reduzit am facilitat.	When that happens, it is important to approach the patient's flank, and not let the abscess form; then the limb should be treated with hot water and oil, and then reduced with ease.
E tot membre sia curat am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra en son loc.	And the whole limb should be treated with that which will bring its memory back to its place.
E yeu ja e ordenatz les capitols de dislocacio segon que es precedit en fractura; de la partida del cos pus sobirana entro a la partida pus dejos.	And I have already ordered the capital of dislocation according to what is preceded in fracture; from the part of the shoulder, enter into the part that has been left behind.
Capitol .xxiiii.	24th chapter.
De curacio de dislocacio de la mandibula dejos.	Of the cure of dislocation of the jaw.
So dislocadas las doas mandibulas si no tart; e la dislocacio de amdos es fayta segon una de dos manieyras: que o son remaugudas de lurs locs per pauca remocio, e so mollificadas un petit; o so dislocadas per entiera dislocacio e complida, entro que sian mollificadas a la partida de la junctura entro que corro saliva del malaute e que no puesca tenir aquela ni puesca claure la sua boca, e la lengua de lu sia envolopada en sa paraula.	If the jaws are dislocated and not torn; and the dislocation of the others is made in one of two ways: that they are moved slightly from their places, and are slightly molded; or they are completely dislocated and completed, until they are molded at the part of the joint where the saliva of the patient flows out and which cannot hold that nor can close their mouth, and their tongue is wrapped in their palate.
Mays quan la dislocacio de lu es pauca, lahoras en las majors disposicios retorna per si an pauca causa.	When the dislocation of it is slight, then return it to its place with some slight cause.
Mays si la dislocacio es entiera e complida, lahoras cove que sia administrada reduccio de lu leugierament, e no sia tardada de tot.	When the dislocation is complete and completed, then apply reduction of it carefully, and not be delayed for a long time.
E es que·l ministre tengua le cap del malaute, e entrometa lo metge le dit pous de la una sieua ma en la razit de la dislocacio de la mandibula dedintz la boca de lu, si la dislocacio es de la una part; o que entrometa les sieus dos pouzes ensemps, si la dislocacio es de doas partz, e les autres ditz de las mas de lu sian defora am les quals enguale; e comanda al malaute que cesse las suas mandibulas e absolva aquelas anar de quascuna partida; e le metge engualhe la mandibula e enpellisca la mandibula entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the minister should hold the patient's head, and insert the doctor's fingers of one hand in the mouth of the patient, on the side of the dislocation of the jaw, if the dislocation is on one side; or that he inserts his two fingers together, if the dislocation is on both sides, and the other two fingers on the patient's cheeks, and equalizes them; and commands the patient to stop his jaws and remove those from each part; and the doctor equalizes the jaw and pushes it back into place before it returns to its original position.
E si dificil es la reducio de lu, e majorment si amdos las mandibulas so essemps dislocadas, lahoras aministra evoporacio am aygua cauda e oli, entro que sia fayta leugiera la reduccio de amdos e no tardes la reduccio de amdos de tot, ayssi quo havem dit.	And if the reduction is difficult, especially if both jaws are dislocated, then administer evaporation with warm water and oil, until the reduction of both jaws is easy and does not delay the reduction of both jaws, as we have said.
E donc cum retornam e so engualadas, e es clausa la boca del malaute e no es mollificada, lahoras pausa sobre aquelas polvils de drap am cerot, e sia fayt de cera e oli rozat; e aprop sia liat am facilitat am liamens mols.	And when they are returned and equalized, and the patient's mouth is closed and not softened, then place a poultice of cloth on those parts, and make it with wax and oil, and apply it to facilitate the movement of the jaws.
E sia le dormir del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e·l cap de lu sia stant entre dos aurelhes, per so que no maugue aquel a la partida dreyta ni a la sinistra; e no li fassas per forsa masteguar alcuna causa; habans la sieua vianda sia forbicio leon, entro que quan las dolors sian remaugudas e las mandibulas so nozadas, lahoras maugue aquo que vol.	And the patient's head should be between two cushions, so that it does not move to the right or left; and do not force anything without a cause; having the same view, let the lion's jaw be opened, until when the pains are relieved and the jaws are unclamped, then move that which you want.
E aquo sia aministrat am facilita, e no trebalhe sobre la apercio de la boca deves la comestio e beure e ocitatio, entro que la mandibula sia nozada e sanada.	And that should be administered with ease, and do not force it through the opening of the mouth for food, drink, and oral hygiene, until the jaw is unclamped and healed.
E si es dificil la reduccio de duas mandibulas quan so dislocadas en alcuna hora e no so convertidas als lors locs, lahoras motas veguadas accideysso febres e soda assidua, e fort leu es alerguat le ventre del malaute, e fort leu e vomeys colera pura.	And if it is difficult to reduce two jaws when they are dislocated in some hour and not converted to their normal positions, then use heated foments and constant heat, and often the stomach of the patient will be inflamed, and often the vomiting will be pure bile.
E quan tu vezes aquo, lahoras sapias que es perdicio; e motas veguadas mor aquel al qual accideys aquo en x dias.	And when you see that, then know that it is dangerous; and often those who are affected by that in several days will die.

De reduccio de la dislocacio de la furcula e de la extremitat del muscle.	On the reduction of dislocation of the clavicle and the extremity of the muscle.

Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De la reduccio de la dislocacio del muscle.	On the reduction of the dislocation of the muscle.
Sapias que·l muscle no es dislocat sino segon tres manieras, de las quals es la una que sia dislocat a la partida del titillic a la partida dejos.	You should know that the muscle is not dislocated in three ways, one of which is when it is dislocated at the acromion to the shoulder.
E la segonda es que sia dislocat a la partida desus del muscle, e aquo es fayt tart; e no es dislocat a las partidas detras per la spalla; e no es dislocat a las partidas denant per les nervis.	And the second is when it is dislocated above the muscle, and that is done by tearing; and it is not dislocated behind the shoulder blade; and it is not dislocated below the neck by the nerves.
E majorment es dislocat e defora eyssit a las partidas dejos deves le titillic, e majorment en aquels dels quals las carns son paucas, leugierament es dislocat; mays en aquels en les quals so motas carns, es eyssit fora am dificultat.	And it is most commonly dislocated and deformed and stuck behind the shoulder blade, and especially in those where the meat is thin, it is easily dislocated; but in those where there is much fat, it is difficult to get out.

And it often happens to many people by trauma or fall, and the muscle of which is filled with abscess, and it is swollen because it has already been dislocated.

E es conoguda la dislocacio de lu quan es a las partidas dejos deves le titillic; per so que distingescas entre le muscle dislocat e·l muscle sa, quar tu atrobas entre aquels diversitat manifesta; e atrobas en le cap del muscle concavitat e dejos le titillic deves le tocament del cap del muscle ayssi quo un huou, e al malaute no pot redusir la sua ma a la sieua aurelha, ni maure aquela per totz movementz.	And it is known as dislocation when the parts behind are deviant from their usual position; so that you can distinguish between the dislocated muscle and the normal muscle, because there are manifest differences between them; and at the head of the concave muscle, beyond the tilt, you should touch the cap of the muscle as if with a hammer, and the patient cannot reduce their hand to its usual position, nor move it at all.
Si es dislocat deves le pietz o ensus, e tu lahoras atrobas manifest tocament, e no es amaguat.	If it is dislocated, you should press or grasp it, and you should immediately feel a manifest touch, and it is not hidden.
E de aquesta dislocacio es fayta leugiera reduccio quan es fresca e le malaute es enfant.	And this dislocation is often reduced when it is fresh and the patient is young.
E la reduccio de lu es que·l ministre eleva la ma de lu a las partidas desus; e aprop pause les tieus pouses dejos le titillic de lu, e eleva la junctura am fortaleza en sus al sieu loc, e·l ministre eleva la ma de lu, e extenda aquela en sus; e aprop pausa aquela dejos quar ela retorna leugierament.	And the reduction of it is that the operator raises the hand of the patient above the parts, and places their fingers behind the tilt of the hand, and strengthens the joint in its usual position, and the operator raises the hand of the patient, and extends it to its usual place; and then pauses it where it returns naturally.
Mays si per aquo que havem dit no retorna, e so del comensament que accidic la dislocacio, motz dias, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia banhat en aygua cauda e sia aministrada enbrocacio que mollifique e liniesca ayssi cum si so coytz razitz de altea, e fenugrec, e melillot en aygua, e sia administrada.	If it does not return, and since the beginning of the dislocation, days have passed, then let the patient be bathed in warm water and administered a decoction that softens and soothes, like if their joints were made of marble, with fenugreek, melilot in water, and it should be administered.
E aprop le malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu dos e sia pausat dejos le titillic de lu espera de lana que sia engual entre levitat e strictura, e aprop le metge pause le sieu talo sobre la spera, e eleva le cap del muscle am vertut, e atire la ma del malaute per que no sia mauguda a las partidas dejos, e autre ministre tengua le cap del malaute, que no sia maugut a las partidas dejos, quar aquela tantost retorna al sieu loc.	Then let the patient be placed on their back and supported by a cushion that is even between elevation and restriction, and let the doctor place their hand on the sacrum, elevate the head of the muscle to virtue, and pull the hand of the patient so that it does not become tangled in the parts behind, and another servant holds the head of the patient, so that it does not become tangled in the parts behind, because at this time it returns to its place.
E si voles, reduzeys aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu fassas esser prezent un home le qual sia pus lonc que·l malaute, e estia de la part de aquel latz, e entrometa le sieu muscle dejos le titillic del malaute e eleve le titillic de lu a las partidas desus entro que·l malaute sia suspendut en ayre, e autre ministre tire la ma del malaute de las partidas dejos del sieu ventre.	And if you wish, reduce the second in this manner: and it is that you make present a man who is longer than the patient, and stand on the side of the other, and insert his muscle behind the titillus of the patient and raise the titillus of him above the parts until the patient is suspended in air, and another servant pulls the hand of the patient from the parts behind his belly.
Mays si le malaute es leugier, lahoras cove que am lu que autre causa sia suspenduda, per so que grave aquel, quar la dislocacio retorna tantost.	If the patient is weak, then assume that another cause is suspended, so that the great one does not return quickly.
E es reduzit eysament segon autra manieyra: e es que sia ficat en terra un fust lonc le cap del qual sia redon de figura, ayssi cum pilo de mortier, que no sia gros ni subtil, e aprop sia pausat dejos le malaute; pus que so pausatz sobre·l cap del fust draps leons, e·l malaute sia stant segon la longitut del fust, e aprop sia extenduda la ma de lu a las partidas dejos del autra part; e sia extendut le cos de lu del autre part am fortaleza, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And if it is reduced by another method: and it should be placed on the ground a long stick with a rounded head, as if with a pestle, which is not too thick or thin, and place it under the patient; then place a lion-shaped cloth over the head of the stick, and the patient should stand along the length of the stick, and extend your hand to the parts behind the other part; and extend the other parts from the other part with strength, because the joint returns to its place quickly.
E si es dificil reduccio de lu per totas las causas que havem ditas, lahoras usa de aquesta cura: e es que tu prenguas un fust la quantitat del qual sia en le lonc de dos brasses, e latitut de aquel sia de quatre ditz, e la grossetut de lu sia aleujat en le preon del tittilic segon aquesta forma:	And if it is difficult to reduce the joint by all the causes we have mentioned, then use this treatment: and you should take a stick of the length of two spans, and its width should be four fingers, and its thickness should be removed at the end of the tip according to this form:
E aprop sobre le cap redon sian liatz drap leons per so que·l fust no ledesca le malaute.	And then place a lion's mane cloth on their head to prevent them from moving the patient.
E aprop sia pausat dejos le titillic del malaute, e sia extenduda la ma o le bras sobre·l fust entro a las partidas dejos, e sia liat le fust sobre le adjutori e le bras e la extremitat de la ma.	And then place your hand or arm under the patient's chin, extend it over their body, and tie the patient's arms to the support and the arm and hand of your own.
Aprop sia pausat le bras sobre un scalo de scala segon la latitut, e la ma sia extenduda a las partidas dejos, e l’autre cos sia suspendut de l’autre part, quar la junctura intra tantost.	And then place your arm on a ladder according to the latitude, extend your hand over their body, and the other thing should be suspended from the other side, because the joint is soon affected.
E cum le intrament de lu es complit segon quascuna maniera que es a tu possibla, e lahoras cove que tu pauses dejos le titillic spera de lana de engual quantitat; e aprop pauza emplastre perparat de polvera de moli am enses e album de huou sobre tot le muscle, ayssi quo es revolvut desus, e aprop strenh dejos le titillic am strictura decent; e le liament sia revolvut sobre le emplastre, e la ma de lu sia annectida al col de lu, e sia leyssat, e no sia mauguda la ma de lu per vii dias.	And if the instrument of the patient is completed according to each possible method, and then cover it with a woolen cloth of equal quantity; and place a prepared paste of powdered myrrh and album of cow's milk over the entire muscle, however, if it is rolled up above, and then strengthen it under the patient's chin with a proper support; and roll the bandage over the paste, and let the hand of the patient be attached to the neck of the patient, and let it be left, and do not make the hand of the patient dirty for seven days.
E cove que sia pausada la vianda del malaute pauca, entro que·l membre sia confortat, quar es pus leugier a la sanacio de lu.	And the patient's food should be kept quiet and still until the member is comfortable, which is more beneficial for their healing.
E aprop la vianda sia donada major aprop vii o v e sia exercitat un movement; e donc si es fermat e no es mollificat, lahoras ja es sanat.	And the food should be given more frequently, around 7 or 8, and it should be exercised with some movement; if it is stopped and not softened, then it is already healed.
Mays si la junctura es dislocada motas veguadas per humiditat que accideys a lu o per autra causa, lahoras cove que en aquela sia administrat cauteri am tres traucs, segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri.	If the joint is dislocated by moisture that has occurred to it or by another cause, then it should be administered an aqueous cautery three times, according to what is said in the chapter on cautery.
E si tot aysso es fayt e aprop vii dias es desliat le liament e la junctura no es fermada, e le emplastre e la strictura son reduzitz sobre lu alcunas veguadas, e no es fermada e catz e no pot elevar aquel bras a las partidas desus, lahoras sapias que·ls nervis de lu, les quals so al cap del muscle, ja so inscizes o extendutz o mollificatz, e sapia que la junctura nul temps no sira ficada en loc sieu.	And if everything has been done and after seven days the ligament and joint are not healed, and the plaster and splint have been reduced over it for some time, but it is not healed and cannot be raised to the parts above, then you should know that the nerves of which, which are at the top of the muscle, have been cut or stretched or softened, and you should know that the joint will never be healed in such a place.
De la dislocacio de aquela qu’es fayta deves le pietz e la mamilha o las partidas detras, la reduccio es fayta am impulcio e extencio am las mas, entro que retorne.	Of the dislocation of that which is made of the chest and breast or the parts behind, reduction is made by impulse and extension at the joints, until it returns.
E sia administrada en aquela l’autra strictura, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And apply it to the other structure, and cure it while it is being healed.
E si accideys aprop la sanacio gravitat en le membre e tarditat en le movement de lu, lahoras le malaute uze de banh motas veguadas entro que aquela gravitat sia alleujada e que retorne a la natura de lu primiera.	And if the healing of the member is delayed and slow, then use bandages wetted with warm water until that gravity is alleviated and it returns to its original nature.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Of the cure of dislocation of the shoulder.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You should know that the shoulder joint is dislocated with difficulty and returns with difficulty; and it is dislocated at all parts, and especially at the part that goes from the front to the back, and the dislocation of which is not hidden from you when it occurs from the fall or from the touch according to whatever figure it is dislocated, and when you adjust the shoulder dislocated, if it does not bend and touch its own muscle, this is a clear sign that the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm, nor touch its own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	And cover the patient, and reduce the dislocation as soon as possible until the abscess is reached, because if you see the abscess, it is difficult to reduce it, and often it is not healed at all; and especially when it is in the back parts, because it is worse than all the other species of dislocation, and causes more pain, and more dangerous movements away from that place, which can lead to death.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	And the restoration of it, when it is possible to reduce it, is that the hand of the patient should be extended towards the two sides, and the arm of the patient should be expanded, and the hands of the doctor should be on the back and below, and he should push the joint towards the palm of his hand until it returns to its place.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is in the back parts, then return as soon as possible to where you double your arm at the elbow, until it strikes the back and the palm of your hand.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not yield to reduction, then apply strong extension and force.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And two assistants should extend the arm, and two assistants hold it in place so that it does not remain dislocated during the extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	Then rotate the arm in all directions, so that it is wrapped in a rolled-up cloth or bandage on your hand or chest.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	When the doctor touches the joint with his hand, he should apply some oil to it so that these causes help in lubricating the joint and facilitate its movement; and then gently push the joint back into place.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And then the reduction of the limb should be placed on that pad where there is astringency and execution with albumen of egg, and it should be extended downwards, and the arm should be suspended from the neck, and left for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it should be removed; and if the joint is formed in its proper place, then you should remove the bandage from it and leave it.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not strong enough, then you should repeat the ointment and bandage, and leave it for several days until it is extended; and then remove the bandage.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	If the gravity of the joint is close to the reduction, and its position is in motion, then administer humidification in baths and gentle friction, and compress it, until it is released; or place a greased cloth over the joint, and leave it on the bone and the night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then place that in the bath; and when you are done, then rub the joint with prepared friction, and repeat over the greased cloth, which is a bandage of motion, once, twice, and three times.
am intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	with a bathing instrument, until it is softened.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if you wish, place a wet and scalded cowhide bandage on that; and do some wraps with it, since that is moist and reduces it to its position.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Of the cure of dislocation of the shoulder, which is the joint between the arm and the shoulder.
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	Sometimes the shoulder is dislocated, and the reduction of this dislocation is difficult, and the opposite is the other joints, but rather, it is important to be quick in reducing it at the time when it is dislocated, because the joint may become frozen or something happens in the frozen joint.
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	And the reduction of this dislocation is that you place the shoulder joint of the patient on a table and the minister extends the arm of that person, and the doctor places his hand or his palm on the edge of the joint, and pushes it back into its place.
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	But rather, it is important to consider whether the palm is already stuck to the shoulder, then the patient should place his back on the table for extension and reduction; and if the dislocation has already occurred, then the position of that person's arm should be naturally on the table, so that the doctor's hand can be placed on the edge of the joint.
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	And if it returns quickly, good; and if not, then you should strongly push that arm to dislodge the abscess and leave that person; and do not repeat this, because otherwise, it will not be easy or possible to reduce the joint again.
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	When the joint is affected by its tortuosity; and the patient does not know any cause, but the muscle is softened and cannot strengthen any cause; then you know that the nerves are trapped or torn, and you should not engage in it, but rather strengthen it with a cauterizing tool for the joint of the patient and strongly apply that to the affected area.
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	Therefore, when the patient is returned, place your hand on the affected area, and let it be loose and strong for several days; and then remove it and let it be loose and exercise the muscle of the patient.
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	If the movement of the patient is stopped and there is some gravity in it, then apply heat with a wet cloth and friction for several days, until it is relieved.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	Of the cure of the aforementioned dislocations.
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	Sometimes these dislocations occur at any time.
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	And when one of these joints is dislocated at the base of the thumb or in the abdomen, then strengthen the joint and push the dislocation back to its place, until it returns.
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	And then support the head of the said patient, suspend the devil's claw to the dislocated part, and leave it for two days.
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	And then suspend that one and extend it until it is equal to the other on that day.
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	And when the injury is not new, apply the second method according to that narration, and do not cease to drain it during the day and exercise movement, and apply it at night; and do that for several days until it is straight.
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	And do the same thing if it is dislocated in the abdomen of the patient, and apply it to that part and do that first operation until it is healed.
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	And similarly do that when it is dislocated in the other parts.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter XXX.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	Of the cure of dislocation of the dorsal vertebrae.
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	When an accident occurs to one of the dorsal vertebrae or neck, and it remains dislocated with some vertebrae from those places, in that case there is no cure, because death approaches the patient.
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	When that happens, the patient's bowel movement is out of their control, and they cannot hold it; and if softening agents are applied to their members or their legs or their arms or one of those, or if a sponge is placed on that spot, where the softening agents are applied and where the softening agents are made, the removal of those is done in four parts.
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	Then that spot is already in the back parts and it is not called gout anymore.
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	The cure of that is that you should consider whether the gout occurred due to puerperal fever, because in that case, neither the cure nor the healing of that is not possible at all.
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	In that case where it comes from the bed or by percussion or by a similar cause to those, as the ancients said about the methods of cure in that long speech, which is the most beneficial; however, I have already opened and exposed that of which little is known, because of its proximity to the understanding of that, which I have exposed and formed from various instruments of that, by which I will show that and explain it.
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	And say that in the case of a fracture that occurs in the chest, there is no cure or healing for that part; and similarly in the one that is made at two times.
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	And those are not cured except by the one that occurs in the back, which I will recommend to you.
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	And it is that the patient should be extended on their face, at an equal distance from the wall, and extended behind it with a wet instrument so that their chest is not lifted.
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	And a pole should be placed, leaning against the ground at the end of the wall near the patient's head, and another pole in front of their feet at the other end of the wall.
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	And the servant should hold the pole, and not be stationary in the ditch; and another servant should hold the other one according to that form.
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then wrap the patient's head with the firm Leopard's tooth; and extend the end of the tooth to the pole that is supposed to support the patient's head, and tie it there; and strengthen the other bandage over the patient's ankles, and supporting their chest; and then adjust all the bandages and tie them to the other pole that is supposed to support the patient's feet.
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	And then the assistant extends the bandage to the part of the wound, and does not remain untied the two bandages and the bandages of the places in which they were placed, but rather does not fasten them as we have said.
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	And the doctor places his hands on the back of the patient between his shoulder blades, or places them on a table, and then adjusts the patient's feet on the table before he returns.
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if he does not return in this way, then take a table whose length or width is about three spans, and dig in the wall where we have said that the patient should be placed between the extremities of the table.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place the majority of the table on the back of the patient, and the doctor places his feet on the other end, and stretches him inward until the back is covered and he returns to his place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you want, open the turn which is turned around the neck; and it is that you should stay on the ground with the head of the patient in the back of the two thighs, the length of which is about an arm, and the head of him in the back of the other two thighs; and the length between each thigh should be a palm, and it has been done in each thigh where the turn returns, and each one should be held in place on the ground so that it does not become untied.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And there should be another rod in which it is the turn, and it should be rotated in the two grooves of the two rods.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at the end of it is a groove in which the rod is formed, its length being one palm and a quarter, which is also rotated; and on the other two rods, there is similarly one.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the cords that you have strung in the chest of the patient in the groove that is to be placed on his head, and the cords that you have strung in the patient's thighs in the turn that is to be placed on his feet.
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then each turn should have a servant who twists the turn with his hand, and the doctor should hold the spine as we have said.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	This is the form of the turn:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And after the spine is returned, and the area is covered, place some cotton on the wound, and stop it; and then place a flat table over the dressing, whose width is three fingers or about those, and its length is the amount that covers the area of the wound, and on the side of the spine, there.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then tie the bandage that we have mentioned, and use the patient as a source of subtle nutrition until they are healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	If there is any imminence in the location at the end of healing, then apply medicines that are both poisonous and liniments for their administration from the table for a long time, which we have recommended; and it is already administered in that location, a layer of plaster.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And some conditions occur in the back of the spine, and it is caused by that dislocation; and that bone which already immines for that reason, so that no harm should be done to you because of this medicine, which would certainly kill you.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter .xxxi.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	Of the cure of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	You should know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle do not end with dislocation alone, but also occur in those who have the same small removal and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the joint of the hip is dislocated in four ways, that it is dislocated at the partitions behind, or at the partitions forward, or at the partitions above, or at the partitions behind.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And it is more commonly dislocated at the parts of the inside, and less so at the parts in front or at the parts behind.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the reason for this dislocation at the inside parts is that when you adjust the bed of the healthy person to the sick person, it is longer and more inclined than the healthy one, and the sick person cannot bend their leg, and this is where the bedsores form due to pressure, because the part of the mattress has already been reached.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the reason for this dislocation at the front parts is that those events of it are contrary to this event.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the reason for this dislocation at the front parts is that when the bed is raised to a second level, but does not bend towards that pain in the leg, and if it is perforated to go out and cannot be placed under those parts in front; and the urine of it is retained and the sitting position of it forms a bedsore, and you must place the ambulation of it on the thigh.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	When the person who has suffered dislocation at the back parts cannot extend their arm, nor bend the one that is bent, and the cushion under them is shorter than the other, and the bent part is softened, and the head of the cushion is placed in that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	The reduction of these species of dislocation is that you consider, if the dislocation is old and ancient, that it has already been cured by having it in your hand, then you administer reduction according to its arrangement, and in that case, do not expect that in that cure there should be any prognosis.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	In the case of the one in which the dislocation is recent, and is one of the four species of dislocation, then you should do that which turns the joint and extends it to the back parts and the front parts, and on the right and left, and for this, the strong return does not need other cure.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	If not, then you should prepare strong medicine and extend the cushion of the part that is farthest from them, or hold their hands, or lay a cloth on the cushion above the arm; and another minister extends the hand of that one over the tips of their fingers; and strongly hold the lion's skin on the surface of the cushion, and have another minister clean the end of the cloth.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And if the extension is from the shoulder to the part of the furcula, or from the back to the part of the backbone.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And if the extension is of all those in a row when the patient is raised to his own side and hanging down.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	This type of extension is especially common in all four cases.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And therefore if the dislocation returns to what we have said, it is good; and if not, then in each case it is necessary to direct the treatment according to its own cure.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of its own dislocation, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is at the parts below, then make the patient lie on his back; and place your hand on the rim of the cushion in that place where the head of the cushion and the place that is left behind are close to each other; and extend the ligament from the side towards the part of the furcula.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And another minister strongly grasps the arms of the patient, and presses the large part of the patient's back and extends it to the parts forward by strong extension, so that it returns to its own place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	This particular treatment is the most effective cure for this member, which is reduced more than other treatments.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	If it is not possible to apply this treatment at all, then bind the two feet of the patient together firmly with a strong, wide bandage over and under the ankles.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And let the length of each be equal to four fingers, and let the patient's bed be extended more than the other by two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	Then the patient should be suspended over the head of the bed, and let them hang lower; and the length of this should be equal to two armpits.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	Then command a strong young man to apply pressure to the cushion, and let another young man suspend it from the patient, and the other young man should strengthen the application with force, so that the joint returns to its place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction, when dislocation occurs at the part of the body, let the patient lie on their back as we have recommended in the previous chapter; and let the bandage be strengthened over the hernia and on the patient's chest.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then bring two chairs for them to sit on, one under their feet and the other under their head; and adjust the chair by the side of the bed where the patient is lying, so that the patient is not dampened by the chair being between their thighs, so that the extension is not pulled at the parts behind.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And each minister extends their part, and the doctor places their hand over the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you follow the reduction, it is generally good; and otherwise, pause over it carefully and have what we have said in the booklet for that equalness.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	May it be that the patient does not move their legs too much.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is at the parts behind, then it is important that the cushion is extended more widely, and according to this method described on page; and the doctor places the palm of their hand on the long axis of the patient, and the other hand covers that, and the hand that covers the extension should be placed at the part behind the dislocation.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	If the dislocation is at the back parts, then do not let the patient be extended at the back parts, and elevated on the ground; having covered them with a soft cloth, as if it is the bed and the anchor of the patient is dislocated at the front parts, according to what we have said about the position of the patient on two anchors; and it is over their face and the bands are extended, as we have said, there is no harm.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And cover with a compressed cloth on the place where the joint is.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Therefore, when the reduction is completed according to what we have covered — and the hand of the reduction of the patient is not pressed against you, and it is that you extend two cushions from the patient, and when you see those equal and the patient extends the other cushion and expands that side, then know that the member according to what we have covered has returned — and then you adjust two things and press and extend the band where the anchor is not damaged in any of the parts; and adhere the patient to rest for three days or four.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then remove the bandage and apply it again, and place one cushion under one arm and the other under the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	If you see those joints correctly in front of you, then know that the dislocation has been fixed, and then let the patient go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause of softening, then return and apply that, and extend it according to your first structure, and leave it for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then remove that, and make that walk in an ambulatory for each person for several days until they are comfortable.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter xxxii.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	Of the cure of dislocation of the thumb.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The thumb is dislocated in three ways, namely it is dislocated at the joint in front, at the joint behind, and at the joint on the side; and at the joint inside it is not dislocated.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of dislocation of the thumb is that you command the patient to place their cushion on the side; then know that the thumb is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	The restoration of all the patient's limbs is done by placing the patient in a supine position, so that they can lie on it; holding their head with your hand, and placing their foot between your feet; and then making them hold your hands with their palms, and bending those towards the back of their neck to strengthen it, and another assistant extending their leg until the patient's foot returns to its place.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	The patient's bed should be made with a non-slip mattress.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then place that plaster on the mattress and make the bed with it, and then apply a bandage for three or four days, and then remove those.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	Do not use the patient's bed for any other purpose until they are healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	If the reduction of the patient to you is excused, then in the treatment of the fracture described in the previous story, apply strong extension to the ligaments of which.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	Of the treatment of talipes equinovarus.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Sometimes the talus is slightly dislocated, and sometimes it is dislocated completely, and the dislocation of this is made at the front or back parts.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that sometimes the talus bulges out from the part where it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	The treatment of its dislocation is usually successful, and it is that it should be extended by the ease of the hands and be equalized until it returns.
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	In the treatment of this dislocation when it is completely dislocated, make sure that the patient lies on his back, and hold one strong and skilled person behind the patient in the middle of the dislocated part.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you take the right hand of the patient and lift the most inferior part of the foot, and with your left hand in the location of the heel.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then bring the foot to your right hand, and with your left hand for two steps, and extend your left hand; and push the sole of the foot towards the right side of the thigh.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And make two incisions according to what we have counted.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	Then place the chest of the patient on the cushion, and you go to the chair.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Therefore, return in one incision or in two according to this method, and if the foot is equal, it is good; otherwise, repeat the operation on it, until it returns.
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from reducing it by the method we have recommended, then make the patient lie on their back on the ground, and place a soft pillow under them, and put a blanket between the patient's thighs, and you have already covered them with a cloth so that they do not descend.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	Then the assistant of the patient holds their limbs, and another assistant extends the foot towards their hands or the cloth that lies on the neck of the patient; and then extend each assistant according to the extension of their own part, and the pillow should be extended between the patient's thighs to retain that, so that the body of the patient is not thrown to the parts behind its extent.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And the doctor should approach the dislocation at its source, and another servant should hold a clean cloth to the parts behind it, as the dislocation returns to its ease.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation returns and it is declared that the patient's health has been restored by its reduction, then pause to apply a strong bandage around it, and tie the foot to the bed.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And be careful not to damage the nerves that are behind the talus, so that the bandage over that does not press too much and it is strong enough.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And leave it like that for two or three days; if the bandage becomes soft, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And remove it on the third or fourth day, and prohibit the patient from walking for ten days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if it is necessary to go through that space, do not do so until the dislocation has been completely resolved and cured, as it would cause more harm.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if the pus in the abscess bursts, then carefully apply what we have described in our narrative, in another place for treatment and healing, until it is completely healed.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter thirty-four.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Of the cure of the aforementioned foot dislocations.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	That which is dislocated should be moved gently and with a little extension of its tendons; and this is not difficult, beforehand.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	If the dislocation is in the hinge joints of the back of the foot, then do so by placing the patient's foot on a level surface or table, and let him remain there as if he were lying down.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you should stand by the patient's foot, and place your hand on the area where the joints are, and gently press that area until it returns to its original position and does not appear in the elevated position.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place a table under the patient's foot that holds the entire foot, with two caps, and strengthen that area with a proper and firm bandage for three days; and then remove it and let him walk around for several days, until it is strong and assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter thirty-five.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Of the special types of dislocation that are caused by strain or by fracture or by any other means.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes occurs, and you perform the cure and restore it, certain complications may lead to death.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And for that reason, you should not assume the cure of it, but rather follow the knowledge gained from long use, mercy and compassion, delayed, not hasty or presumptuous; and that in the beginning of medicine, they yield to abscesses only with caution, and leave the patient to divine judgment, not to any other, but to him for whom there is hope of salvation from perdition, and in which there appears some hope.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And therefore, you should first try to reduce it in the beginning of the cause, giving it time to form an abscess with caution.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then, if the member returns after they wish, then administer a regimen that yields to abscesses with caution and cures the strain with what is appropriate for it from drying substances.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if dislocation is accompanied by fracture and accidents occur in the bones that are separated, then puncture their joints, and do as we have said in the simple cases of that, in the locations of those.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And guard and avoid that second instrument in the ways of fear according to what I have previously preached; because that is better for you to leave to your own Creator, and more lasting to your glory, and more salutary for your health, as you will see those in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Here ends the words of Albucasis perfectly from which God may be blessed.
Amen.	Amen.
